data.message: Thanks and like the video you made. But... as Privacy Settings have been "only me" then, ... Still keep in private?

replies.message: Hi, Demi. Your Friends Day video will only be visible to you unless you decide to share it. You can share it publicly, with friends only, or any audience you wish, just like any other Facebook post by selecting the audience after clicking “Share.”  However, the audience who sees it could be limited by the photos included in the video, as we'll respect the privacy settings on each of the photos in the video. -Rhea

Dear, the question I tried to ask is about the settings have been set up as "only me". But without the user's consent to collect and edit information is an OK act?  Even a great video has been made. Just wondering.
Thanks and like the video you made. But... as Privacy Settings have been "only me" then, ... Still keep in private?
